str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and choreo; to retire.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A dream. Of uncertain derivation; a dream.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Egypt. Of uncertain derivation.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.
From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
